greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangular array (a Riordan array) related to tennis ball problem, read by rows.
comment: Riordan array (2/(2-x*c(x)+x*c(-x)), x*c(x)), with c(x) the g.f. of Catalan numbers (A000108). - _Ralf Stephan_, Dec 29 2013
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n=0..100 of triangle, flattened
D. Merlini, R. Sprugnoli and M. C. Verri, The tennis ball problem, J. Combin. Theory, A 99 (2002), 307-344 (Table A.2).
mathematica: c[t_]:= (1-Sqrt[1-4*t])/(2*t); d[t_]:= (1-(1+2*t)*Sqrt[1-4*t] -(1-2*t)*Sqrt[1+4*t] +Sqrt[1-16*t^2])/(4*t^2); g[t_, r_]:= d[t]*(t*c[t])^r; Table[SeriesCoefficient[Series[g[t, k], {t, 0, n}], n], {n, 0, 10}, {k, 0, n}]//Flatten (* _G. C. Greubel_, Jan 16 2019 *)
xref: First column is A066357 interspersed with 0's, 2nd column gives A079514.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 22 2003
ext: Edited and more terms added by _Ralf Stephan_, Dec 29 2013
